unicorn_effects.name: Unicorn Effects
unicorn_effects.description: Visual operations applied to layers in Unicorn Studio

filters.definition: Color-based effects: tint, contrast, saturation, color grading
filters.code_equivalent: Fragment shader color operations or post-processing passes
example_prompts: Add a warm color grade to this hero section
Apply a desaturated filter effect like Unicorn's filters

distortion.definition: Warping/displacing pixels or vertices: waves, noise, refraction
distortion.code_equivalent: Displacement shaders in GLSL/TSL or post-processing
example_prompts: Create a wave distortion effect on scroll
Add noise-based displacement to this image

blur.definition: Softening or streaking content: Gaussian, directional, zoom, bokeh
blur.code_equivalent: Multi-pass Gaussian blur nodes in post-processing
example_prompts: Add a zoom blur effect on hover
Create a bokeh-style background blur

lighting.definition: Simulated lights, glow, highlights, rim light effects
lighting.code_equivalent: PBR lighting or custom BRDF in Three.js materials
example_prompts: Add a rim glow effect to this 3D object
Create directional lighting with soft highlights

stylize.definition: Non-photoreal looks: halftone, posterize, grain, glitch, edge detection
stylize.code_equivalent: Custom fragment shaders or post-processing effects
example_prompts: Apply a halftone effect like print media
Add glitch distortion triggered by scroll

custom.definition: User-defined shaders authored inside Unicorn's custom category
example_prompts: Replicate this custom Unicorn shader in Three.js
Extend the default effect with custom GLSL

webgl.definition: Browser graphics API for GPU-accelerated 2D/3D rendering
webgl.unicorn_relation: Unicorn scenes and Three.js content both render via WebGL

webgpu.definition: Next-gen GPU API with better compute and performance
webgpu.unicorn_relation: Used with TSL/node-based systems for advanced 3D or particle effects

render_loop.definition: Continuous function that updates and renders each frame
render_loop.unicorn_relation: Often synced with scroll or time for interactive experiences

post_processing.definition: Extra render passes after main scene: bloom, DOF, color grading
post_processing.unicorn_relation: Mimics Unicorn filter/stylize effects in code

render_pass.definition: Single draw/processing step; multiple can be chained

scene.definition: Container for objects, lights, and cameras

example_prompts: Animate camera on scroll
Create perspective camera with 75 FOV

mesh.definition: Geometry + Material instance to be rendered

material.definition: Surface appearance: color, texture, reflectivity, shading model

texture.definition: 2D image or data map: color, normal, roughness, AO

environment_map.definition: Cubemap or equirect for reflections and IBL

ambient_light.definition: Uniform light, no direction, no shadows; base fill
example_prompts: Add subtle ambient fill light

directional_light.definition: Parallel rays like sunlight; can cast shadows
example_prompts: Create directional key light for hero

point_light.definition: Emanates from point in all directions; intensity falloff
example_prompts: Add point light for localized glow

spot_light.definition: Cone-shaped with angle and penumbra; focused highlights
example_prompts: Create spotlight effect for product showcase

hemisphere_light.definition: Gradient from sky to ground color; outdoor ambient
example_prompts: Add hemisphere light for natural outdoor feel

vertex_shader.definition: Positions vertices, can deform geometry: waves, wobble, displacement
example_prompts: Create vertex displacement for wave effect
Add noise-based vertex deformation

fragment_shader.definition: Computes final pixel color: lighting, shading, effects
example_prompts: Write fragment shader for gradient effect
Add cel-shading in fragment shader

compute_shader.definition: General-purpose GPU compute for particles, simulations
example_prompts: Use compute shader for particle system

gaussian_blur.definition: Double render-pass blur to soften or create glow
example_prompts: Add Gaussian blur post-processing

fresnel.definition: View-angle rim highlight for glow/outline effects
example_prompts: Add Fresnel rim glow to edges

cel_shading.definition: Quantized lighting bands for anime/comic look
example_prompts: Apply cel-shading to character model

displacement_mapping.definition: Texture or math moves vertices for waves, ripples
example_prompts: Create displacement map for terrain

pbr.definition: Physically-based: baseColor, metalness, roughness, normal, AO
example_prompts: Set up PBR material with roughness map

gsap.definition: JS animation library for timelines and tweens
example_prompts: Animate camera position with GSAP
Create GSAP timeline for section reveals

scrolltrigger.definition: GSAP plugin linking scroll position to animation progress
example_prompts: Trigger animation at 50% scroll
Scrub timeline based on scroll position

lenis.definition: Smooth scroll library feeding delta to GSAP and render loop
example_prompts: Set up Lenis for buttery scroll
Sync Lenis with Three.js render loop

scroll_driven_camera.definition: Camera position/rotation/FOV updated by scroll progress
example_prompts: Move camera through scene on scroll
Rotate camera 360° across page scroll

scroll_parallax.definition: Foreground/background move at different scroll speeds
example_prompts: Add parallax depth to hero layers

integration_patterns.name: Integration Patterns
integration_patterns.description: How to use Unicorn with code stacks

unicorn_embed.definition: Export Unicorn scene as lightweight embed for Framer/Webflow/custom sites
example_prompts: Embed Unicorn scene in Next.js
Add Unicorn SDK to React project

unicorn_to_threejs.definition: Replicate Unicorn effect logic in custom Three.js/R3F code
example_prompts: Convert Unicorn distortion to Three.js shader
Mirror Unicorn lighting in R3F

hybrid_stack.definition: Unicorn for 2D FX layer, Three.js for deep 3D environments
example_prompts: Layer Unicorn effects over Three.js scene
Use Unicorn for UI, Three.js for 3D product

tsl.name: TSL
tsl.definition: Node-based system generating shaders for WebGPU
